review: Have you ever seen Shutter Island.  Go to this McDonald's.  It's tight, food is always McDonald's food and the service is Classic Chicago baby!  McChicken add tomato's, pickles, mustard.  ~$1.33 spshhhssh.   Derrrrrrr.  I order on the app and pick my cheap consistent food up when I'm darn ready.  Don't give anyone change.

Not the best experience today. If I order at the kiosk I ASSUMED it would be faster. It usually is. Not today.  I purchased water and a sandwich.... it sat there. While the manager was helping a cashier count out a patrons changed-all coins. I believe the cashier needed help with the nickels and dimes. But I am on a 30min lunch. Why does it take 2 pol to count change in nickels and dimes?. An off day for my fav McDonalds.
I guess my previous solid review jinxed it. This location has gone downhill. Missing sauces, long waits, and unfriendly staff.

I love this McDonald's, mostly because you can order at the self-service kiosk, which doesn't take cash (but who carries cash anyways). When you eat in, the staff bring your food to you and have always been polite and friendly. Today, they even gave me a cup of water without me asking.   This location has always been clean when I visit and they even put up seasonal decorations. Although at McDonald's you get what you pay for in terms of food, this location is a stand-out in my eyes.

Bright location with cheery employees. Nice to see a place where they smile when helping you.   Coffee is nice and hot the way I like it! Have only tried the sausage biscuit here so far which tastes great.

Stop by McDonald's at 203 N. LaSalle this morning for breakfast.  Upon arriving security was harassing an individual about whether he bought his own food or not.  He was trying to explain that he paid for his own food, but I guess they were not listening and where trying to either take his food and put him out the McDonalds.  My question is does it matter who paid for the food?  It was not stolen.  He seem to have a receipt.  If the food is paid for you should be entitled to eat it no matter who paid for it.  If you are going to have a restaurant in downtown Chicago, attached to the CTA  location, with four different directions to enter the McDonald's, you are going to get all types of people.  McDonald's should be happy anybody wants to eat their food.  Unfortunately, I loss my appetite and left.  I do not want to eat at a McDonald's that harasses their customers about who paid for their food.

The only McDonald's that serves the global menu! They switch the menu from time to time, so don't expect the same things you see online. When I went, I got the HK style wasabi fries and Australian spicy buffalo chicken sandwich (which is pricer than their regular menu items). I ordered off the self ordering screen (which was nice since you could see all the options and take your time, therefore it takes awhile to wait in line).  The wasabi fries were def spicy. They give you regular fries with a shake bag and a package of wasabi seasoning. You were supposed to put the fries and seasoning in the bag and shake it to make them. Knowing how spicy wasabi is, I only put half the packet with the medium size of fries, but they were still super spicy. It evenly coats all of the fries well. I ended up not finishing the fries, because it was too much, but it did give a nice kick of wasabi -- similar to wasabi peas.  The chicken sandwich was alright. The chicken was crispy, but it seemed somewhat uncooked in the center. The chicken was soft and chewy, so I ended up not finishing the sandwich either. My friend said she order the same sandwich, but they ended up looking somewhat different (hers had bacon on it???)   Otherwise, the location was clean and there were nice tables and chairs (better than a regular mcd). Seemed like a lot of the workers go there to eat. (Giving an extra star just for the ambiance of the place tbh)

I'm not a McDonald's person. SOMEONE TOOK ME WITH THEM. Anyway. Ordering online does NOT get you your food faster. I ordered at the register and got my food before someone who ordered online.   Chaos on the ordering line vs everyone standing around to pick up food. People were confused on who was waiting for what.   We requested very specific sauces, but they gave no sauces to either of us then looked at us like we were crazy for coming back to ask.   ALSO my comrade was skimped out of a chicken tender on that 6 piece box so it was a very odd numbered 5 piece box instead.   Potential loiterer passed out on a table upstairs. Tables not wiped off after people eat. Eh I didn't have high expectations so I guess it's okay.

This is my favorite McDonald's location in the loop.   It's open late. It's always been clean. Staff's always been quick and kind.   Food is always as good as you can expect, and it actually looks the way it does on the commercials. It's a perfectly okay place to shove food in your face after a play before you get back to your hotel.

I was looking for a quick bit.  This restaurant is just another unkept place.  Food is okay.  Service is horrible.  People demanding money or food outside of the door.    I would recommend another place.

When I was here on Wed Apr 4, 2017 there was a very loud argument going on between some "patrons" & the store manager just stood by and made NO attempt to get them to leave the store or be quiet.  The CPD did arrive after 10 minutes but only 1 of the "patrons" were asked to leave.  To top it off, one of the disruptive patrons had the nerve to ask for new food as hers was now cold.  Of course the staff had to stop what they were doing and remake her order.  I would give this location NO STARS but yelp doesn't offer that feature.
A-OK McDonalds with outdated decór, this has two-levels of dining options. The food I ordered was accurate. I wasn't brave enough to do a bathroom review. Sorry guys.

So I come in to order some oatmeal I place my order after a lengthy wait in line. I order the oatmeal when I go up to the line I ask for a cup of water. The manager tells me 33 cents. Really??? Then I get my oatmeal and the cup ok jut 1/3 full and looks crappy as can be. So don't believe the McDonald's commercial. They suck even for something as simple as oatmeal and water.
Not the first McDonald's lately where the Wi-Fi didn't work and the app won't launch properly. :/

This is not a place to take KIDS! The place is a cross between insane asylum and a homeless pantry with no showers.  While cleaning off my syrup covered table covered in salt I sat by the lovely windows across from Peterrinos (a great place).  As my shoes began to stick to the floors that have not been mopped or swept I began to sweat. The windows were actually cooking me while I sat and waited.  I moved to another area on the second floor and noticed a not see clean person pretending to drink coffee.  The person would watch tourist seeing if they have an IPAd or nice cell phone to snatch up. One tourist actually was looking for an electric outlet to steal electricity luckily Mickey-dees knows its customer and you could charge nothing with no outlets present.  The food was edible... If you value your purse do not leave any property you own out of your site.  Enjoy the drunk homeless parade in front of the place i actually counted "7" vagrants! I know what a junky looks like and hate to say it they all had the heroin look!  Service was slow on a weekend with only 3 people working?   So stop in for a cheap soda or ice cream cone if you can handle vagrants walking up to you and your family while you eat smelling like urine.  P.S.  HIRE some security guards MCD keep your customers safety a priority!

After needing a little something extra for lunch, a co-workers and I stopped in for a quick bite and it was fine.  Décor: It's a McDonald's, not much more is needed to say. It's relatively clean, well lit, and there are enough tables upstairs for a lunch rush. Bathroom: also relatively clean, but you need a code to open the door...  Staff: The cashier was fine. She wasn't overly friendly, or personable, but wasn't in a seemingly bad mood.  Food: It's McDonald's and that's why I love it! You know what you're getting and that taste... it's such a comfortable feeling chowing down on a McDouble and crushing a strawberry milkshake.  Value: Again, it's McDonald's. However, I hate when the Dollar Menu has items that are over $1. In fact, the ONLY item on this Dollar Menu that is $1 was a freaking ice cream cone! Now, granted, other items were $0.25-$0.75 more but still, it's the principle of the thing!  I'm a huge McD's fan, always have been and always will be. I may not come often, but I'll always come back.

Poor service and not clean. There are other nearby restaurants (including McDonald's) that are clean and include good service. I was there at lunch time - maybe it's clean with decent service at other times besides lunch?

Came in late night after a musical. On the same block as the Oriental Theatre.   Food was ok. Additional $0.55 for drink refills. $0.30 for water.   Dirty bathroom.   Wheelchair accessible but it has two double doors. No door opener.

The workers are fast but this does not apply to the cashiers, which are kinda slow. I ordered a happy mean for my little toddler brother and got a girl toy. Obviously the cashier didn't realize he was a boy, but oh well. They got the food out pretty fast and it was hot. Overall nice staff but they gots to start putting ketchup with our meals if they see we order fries!
I took me almost 10 minutes to get my order.  The cashier was rude.  I'll not come back to this location again.

I've tried the McDonald's at 36 W Randolph (Dearborn and Randolph) 3 separate times.  Each time when I sat down to eat, I was harassed by homeless men trying to bum money or a free lunch.  They are very aggressive and made me very nervous.  Each time I complained to the manager who could have cared less.  I will never go into this location again. I live in River North and frequent the McDonald's at 600 N Clark St and I've never had any problems there.  McDonald's needs to hire a security guard for the 36 W Randolph location to protect it's customers from this constant harassment.

This McDonald's is great.  They have a hard working crew and the food is always hot and fresh.  I'm not saying they're perfect, but they get it right the majority of the times that I visit for breakfast or lunch.  For those people who read the "worst ever" reviews, check out how many times these comments are repeated almost verbatim on McDonald's restaurant pages.    It sucks that Yelp does nothing about it, and it sucks that the people who work hard at a good McDonald's gets slandered.

With an hour before I needed to head to the airport, I didn't have time to find a local breakfast spot. Since eating is better than the alternative, I stuck with an enemy I knew: McDonald's. This location was near our hotel, had two levels, and a decent amount of seating.  When I placed an order for twenty Chicken McNuggets, I was politely refused, and told they weren't available during breakfast service. Dejected (and surprised, as I really wanted them), I turned to read the menu, when their manager said she could make me some, but it'd take time. (I agreed and happily waited a few extra minutes for them.) Talk about customer service!  Also shared an order of hot cakes (strangely spongy "pancakes") with sausages which did their job, soaking up any alcohol that my liver didn't get to.

Absolutely disgusting! I'm easy to please, so it must be bad if im writing a negative review. There is sauce and food all over  the ground, it took forever for our food to come out, and they were out of all but 2 soft drinks. The upstairs is closed so everyone is standing around eating, and allll trash cans are over flowing.

Two words: one-person-at-a-time bathroom. Wait. Well, you get the idea. If you're in the area, say at the Christkindl Market, Garrett's popcorn, or in a long line waiting for tix at the theater next door, this McD's has a clean modern unisex bathroom  (and a door that locks) on the main floor, with a (wait for it)....Xcelerator hand drier! If you think I'm crazy because I love the power of the Xcelerator, then you just haven't been blown by one.   The rest of this McDonald's isn't bad. Upstairs seating overlooks the bustling street of the theater district, and has some vaguely modern decorating scheme. Sure, there's homeless that hang out here, but the bathroom was clean, and I've seen way worse McD's.
This is one of the better McDonald's they staff is nice, the service is fast and the food was good!

I normally would never rate McDonald's but this could possibly be one of the top 3 worst McDonald's in the city  The other day they gave me a salad with no fork or dressing. Always understaffed and screwing up orders  Its sad when I know before going in my experience is gonna suck and then WHAM it happens  This place sucks brah!!!!!

I never write reviews so you can see how bad this McDonald's is.  We ordered a kid's meal and it came with a toy that was offered in 2012 but Penguins of Madagascar was on displayed.  It did not come with napkins so I had to stand in line to get some.  Then we realized there was no ketchup that came with the fries, so I had to stand in line again.  I saw signs that they charge for extra condiments and also $0.50 for water.  I realize there are a lot of panhandlers in the area, but it just doesn't seem right.  It was late at night so the 2nd floor was closed and therefore we could only use the one restroom on the ground floor.  It stink and I couldn't wait to get out of it.  This McDonald's is the worst one that I've ever been to.
Best McDonalds in the loop. 2 large fries for 2.75?   Plus the other closest McDonalds doesn't even have large coke for $1... what??
FAST FAST FAST! Not sure there's much else you'd be looking for in a fast-food joint. Sure, it's also clean and convenient to the shops on State St.

Yes. I can now confirm there is only one bathroom. I really needed it - like yesterday! But someone ha to take care of business... So after like 5 minutes of standing outside the bathroom door... Things got better!  But wait a sec! After asking them, there is a mens and Women's bathroom upstairs!! Majesty's to let them know ahead of time and they can buzz you into the restroom. The restrooms were in very good shape. Clean. And well-maintained. Impressed that it was insuch good shape, esp. For being a McD's right dab in the middle of the city.   The workers are very quick to serve - not too lazy (the ones in today)! For a McD's in city, pretty impressed.   Way to go!!

I dont know why I should write a review for McDonalds.   All my visits here, this McDonalds is so DIRTY.  A few days ago, I came to get a quick bite in between my shopping, they were out of straws. I was like, wait--what do you mean you're out of straws?!?!  I've worked in a restaurant before. You DONT JUST RUN out of straws unless 150 buses of schoolchildren decide its funny to steal your straws.  They all just shrugged and said there weren't any straws.  Also, they happened to be out of ketchup that day. No ketchup packets, no ketchup in the pumps. My dbl cheeseburger had ketchup on it though.   They were just lazy that day, or trying to cut down on operational costs. not sure. but i feel like writing a letter to corporate.

Probably one of the better McDonald's in the city, but I still don't think that warrants anything higher than 3 stars.  Menu is typical, space is limited, and there is only one single-stall restroom.  It's fine.  Nothing better, nothing worse.

The fries were not cook enough, the sald was missing most of the ingredients and NO SALAD DRESSING!!!! I had the order to go so when I got to my office I couldn't go back and complain!!!  I will never ever go back to this place!
The service was great. The man at the counter was very nice. The food was eh. My fries were cold.

Hands down, WORST McDonalds on this planet. They have no clue what they are doing. EVERY order I have placed there they have messed up, and just now, it took three try's to get a simple burger right: dumbasses. DO MOT GIVE THEM BUSINESS. 0 stars!

I have never written a review on here, much less on a fast food chain such as Mickey D's, but this establishment is the worst one I have ever come across. Right off the get-go I know it was not going to be a very timely visit because there were only two people waiting for food and three people working, and somehow they managed to take 10 minutes to prepare an order. After taking my order, which was the easiest thing you could make (McChicken plain only ketchup and a Cheeseburger only ketchup), I waited, and waited, watched two of my buses go by, and waited. I got so fed up because after ten minutes of waiting for McDonald's, you're pissed off and I didn't want to miss another bus since the next one was in 15 minutes. I just told the cashier to give me the cheeseburger that was ready and that's all I wanted because I wanted to eat-n-go. I never received the McChicken and the only positive thing was that the cashier offered small fries to me, which was courteous. Mind you that the cooks already made two McChickens for the order after me, and those were ready before I ever received anything. The cooks could barely speak English, so I believe the language barrier impacted their understanding of all the orders because every order had some type of mess up, no joke. Upon opening and digging into my cheeseburger like a ravenous hyena, I came to discover that it had mustard and onions on it. I threw it into the garbage and barely managed to catch my bus home and went home pissed off. I will never entertain the thought of eating here again. Oh yeah, and the smell of homeless people here is a delight.

I know McDonald's don't need reviews, but I had breakfast (of sorts .. if hashbrowns count) here against my will.   I must say, go to another McDonald's if you want to sit. The top floor where most of the seating is located, was closed off the day I went (Sunday - which may not be their busiest day, but still). The seating on the main floor was sparse. No booths, just stools against the windows. Pretty crappy if you're here with a group.   "Good for Kids: NO" - They shouldn't be eating fast food, you irresponsible dumbass parent.

I popped in here today to get a cup of coffee and sit and work for a while. But there was trash scattered about on the floor, and I was approached by three panhandlers in the span of 20 minutes. I left, and I won't be back.

This review would include the consonants CLSTRFCK.  I know; it's a McDonald's. But there are some things for which McDonald's should be king: 1) Being cheap 2) Being fast 3) Being standardized  All of these generally lead to a efficient meal. Free mocha Mondays + a husband who enjoys $1 double cheeseburgers + a childhood affinity for salty fries = bring on the efficiency.  But at this McDonalds, the staff never knows what's going on. The customers stand clumped together, swearing they just ordered a meal but having no evidence of this. Things take forever. Cashiers stare blankly. I leave confused. It's the only MickeyDee's I've ever been to, in decades of a consumerist Western life, that messes up my order.  Oh, and it's grody.

Yeah, I'm reviewing McDonald's.  I come here for a breakfast sandwich every now and then because I work next door. They are fast. They get my order right. And, the upstairs seating is nice, despite the insane amount of homeless loiterers stinking the place up.  Plus, I have a fond memory of eating at this place one day in high school.

It's McDonalds and evilly corporate.  I know this.  But you know what?  Sometimes you just want some fucking McNuggets, you know what I'm saying?  Not only that, the double chee meal deal with an orange drink is the ultimate hangover cure.

yeah, this Mickey Dee's is not the best in the area (a block away, 201 N. Clark, is better).  It takes a while to order, their lines are non-descript, the layout is weird to say the least, and you wait and wait and wait for your food.  Also, there's usually at least one of their staff who gives a bitchy response if you dare to ask where your 'fast' food is after way too long.  Best thing is that they have a you-fill-your-cup pop station.

So, here's another McDonald's review. They practically surround me in the loop. I rarely go to this one because it's right next to the theatre district and Garrett's popcorn. Basically, it's the McD's that serves the tourists for this part of State Street. The interior is dark and has a mini marquee of the local theatres since it buts up against them. It also serves as a haven for the homeless that mill around that part of Randolph street. In terms of customer service, I've had your average experience here. For a McD's, the food quality isn't good and have had burnt fries here a few times. It's your basic McDonalds just not the best in the area.

This McDonald's is a 24-hour location next to the W Hotel - City Center and across the street from the JP Marriott. Definitely convenient if you need a quick fix at an odd hour due to an event or travel.  The inside was clean and you have the option of ordering off two self-serve kiosks or from the register. My boyfriend and I opted for the kiosks and moved to the side to collect our orders from the pickup counter.   My boyfriend got his meal within a couple of minutes; mine took closer to ten. There was a wait on hash browns - he must have gotten the literal last one since we both had them in our order.   I ordered a sausage biscuit with cheese, a hash brown, and a yogurt parfait.  + Sausage biscuit: I haven't had this since I was in elementary school, and it was surprisingly not bad. The patty had no weird bits, the biscuit was soft, and the added cheese was completely melted.  + Hash brown: straight out of the fryer and blazing hot/predictably delicious.  + Yogurt: this is the first time I've ever gotten one where the fruit isn't completely frozen. The juices make the yogurt appear a little curdled, but it was a small tradeoff to not have to crunch on frozen fruit.   The only note was that the super hot hash brown was placed in the bag with the yogurt - we were just walking next door so it didn't affect anything, but it would have made more sense in the hot bag with my sandwich.   Obviously McDonald's isn't anything to go out of the way for, but it was a quick and easy breakfast for $5 before heading out of town.

Pretty hard to review and critique a McDonald's...especially to differentiate among them. But I'll say this one was very well run.   For a lot of inner city McDonald's...and this one is in downtown Chicago...it takes a bit of effort to keep people moving, and to insure the seating doesn't end up with street peeps lounging around and driving the customers away. This store was well run and spotless inside. Good management and employee selection here.  They had staff working the tables all the time to remove any refuse, and to clean up and prepare the tables for the next group. They managed this very well. The store is right on a corner, so they have perfect location. The food was the usual...good and hot...nothing laying around getting cold. Place your order...move over...pick it up...and head out or have a seat. Nice and simple. McDonald's and this location have this down pat. Try it.

The service here is TERRIBLE!! They take FOREVER to just get our drinks. It's ridiculous!!! We waited over 30 minutes for a few drinks! It's like they're running around with their heads cut off. Not cool.

Terrible service, came here today for breakfast waited in the line fir 5 min, short hair dark skin lady in blue shirt at register didn't acknowledge me even I was in the line first so she just skipped me and serve someone else. I said to her that I was first in the line and she was mute,I will never come back

As far as McDonald's goes, this is the nicest one in the area. It is quite clean, especially in the morning.  The ordering system by being able to go to a cashier or a kiosk is nice.  It's also nice to have different sections for ordering and picking up food.  The food always comes out fast too.  The employees are also very nice.

This is one of the best McDonald's I've ever been to that it compelled me to write something - even for a McDonald's.  It's close by to work so I come here pretty regularly and it's always good - service and the quality of the food.  Really what stands this McDonald's out is the service and the friendliness of the employees.  This one does table service for dine-in so you just order, take a number stand and they drop off your order to your seat when it's ready.  They always ask if you need ketchup or anything else before they walk away.  I've even had them offer to throw my tray away when I was done even though I'm more than willing to throw my own trash away.  The food always comes out fresh, tasty and consistent.  And they don't over salt the fries.  So I like coming here because they are so friendly here, and when you're craving that McDonald's Quarter Pounder.

I haven't eaten McDonalds in a really long time. This one was really good. I always order my fries with no salt and wait with bated breath for someone to walk over, not read the note, and dump a pile of salt on. That didn't happen. They got it right! I was then annoyed that my McGriddle was taking a while, but considering it was 6 in the evening, there's probably no cakes just out and waiting. My complaints diminished when I got the freshest  McGriddle I've ever had. Plus, there's fancy music which is random and cool at the same time.
Very close to the JW Marriott and open pretty much always. You can order electronically or at the counter. Decent service and what I bought was a hot fudge sundae.
The worst customer service I have ever received. Manager was incredibly rude and unhelpful. Please avoid this place.
There is a cappy Latina cashier that is quite pushy and seems to barely speak English. She even got my order wrong. It was a major bummer.
I ordered food via Uber eat  .. they charged me for a salad I never got n a mocha caramel .. si basically they charged me for stuff they didn't sent me !!!

This is probably the nicest McDonald's I've ever been to. It's really clean inside and the music that's playing is strangely soothing, haha. It was the first time I saw a self-order machine at a McDonald's.
Food always hot. Service is quick. I love the self order kiosks and how they bring the food to your table. Also 24 hours. Can't beat that!

Morning rush hour, took forever - get back to work and I see they did not give me my whole order that I paid for. How hard is it?  Better off going into Union Station, always quick and efficient and never got my order wrong.

This was next door to the hotel and became our go to for late night while we were there. They seemed to be short staffed and it took a long time to get your order. Lots of seats available ad free wifi w

I come here every morning for coffee, and occasionally for lunch.  They seem to have a pretty consistent core staff there that knows what they are doing.  It gets busy around peak times since it's in the middle of the loop, but they usually get the food out pretty quick and keep the line moving.  It's McDonald's... so by now you should know what to expect with the food.  It's tasty and consistent, but definitely not healthy or gourmet.  When a coffee is $5 at the stand in my office building, it's nice to still be able to go next door and grab a $1.50 McDouble.  They are open 24 hours too, so if you happen to find yourself in the middle of the loop at 2am (I have no idea why) this will likely be one of the few places open.

This is by far the best city McDonald's that I have ever been to.  I ordered 2 Medium Fries for $2 and they were perfectly cooked.  Warm, crisp, golden, and just great.  Some locations pull out their fries from the fryer too early which leaves them soggy and not golden.  This is of course to get the line moving.  I also ordered a McChicken with Big Mac sauce which was also excellent.  I was curious about how a chicken Big King would taste at Burger King, but I don't like the Burger King downtown.  Lastly, I ordered a caramel sundae and an ice cream cone.  Both of these items were also excellent.

The service is ok.They are busy .There is a male african american employee who is always cleaning.who has a very positive and friendly attitude.He is the best employee,I have seen at this location. The management is what surpruses me.they all are wearing large hoop earings, some employees have watches , rings and nails are painted.What happened to the food laws .We lead by example.I am food certified and I follow rules .obviously McDonald's makes there own.

This McDonald's is right next door to The W Hotel - City Center.  Good place for breakfast. Ordered the Sausage, egg, and cheese McGriddle value meal - with a small coffee. They added the cream to the coffee for me - I added the sweetener.  McGriddle value meal was very tasty - however, the coffee was kind of weak. I ended up pitching the coffee. If the coffee had been better - I would have upped the rating to four stars.
Worse service I've ever had. Waited 20 minutes for 1 meal which they got wrong. Only go if it's your only option
Friendly service, food as expected. Great people-watching windows right underneath the L tracks.

Avoid this place! No Big Mac or French fry is that da*m good to get possibly robbed over! Came here a few weeks ago w/ my family on a Sunday night and b/c it was close to Michigan Ave & located in the loop, we thought that it would be fairly safe. Wrong! Upon entering, we found a set of tables in the back corner to sit at & within a few minutes we saw that there were some people standing outside looking inward at this skinny guy who was wearing all red w/ long dreadlocks. This skinny guy also looked back out at them, as if they were in some sort of communication. The skinny guy in red w/ the dreadlocks kept looking over at our direction & seemed to be building himself to come over to possibly ask for something. He seemed hesitant but after about 7-8 mins, he starts walking toward our direction. Suddenly, it seems that he changes his mind at the last minute as he quickly turns around & randomnly sits down across from an older man nearby our table, who is sitting by himself. The young man leans over & whispers something to the old man, who looks terrified. The old man shakes his head but then goes into his pocket & takes out some money & hands it over to the young male. The young male then gets up & leaves McDonalds. Literally, not even 1 minute after he leaves, an older woman comes in; she walks very quickly, slightly hunched over as if she is covering something in her hands & goes directly up to a tourist couple sitting by the window. She slightly exposes the part of her sweater that she is folding up & appears to ask them for something. This, on top of what had just happened, felt too suspicious so I immediately told my family that it was time for us to leave. Good thing I did b/c right after I said that, she came around the corner to our table and asked if we wanted to buy some chocolates from her. This felt very off since she was an adult, appeared to be in her late 50s, selling what appeared to be elementary school children chocolate fundraisers. When we politely declined, she gave a bad attitude & mocked us. Fortunately, we were able to leave this place w/o any problems but on our way out, there was a bigger woman standing on the corner that kept eyeing us the entire time (particularly, my purse) which felt very alarming. As such, for your own safety, do not come to this place at all!!!!

Since my last review three years ago, this McDonald's location has figured out how to make things work with the change to the new system of order at the registers on the left side of the counter, and pick up under the tv on the right side that displays ready orders. Seating is good and contemporary, it's a little crowded in the area on front of the food delivery counter where you wait for your order, but overall an average McDonald's.
Pathetic. What a complete waste of time. They are getting 2 stars only because I'm generous when I'm drunk.

This McDonalds looks like it was newly remodeled. I was really thirsting for a drink and decided to come here for an iced coffee. There was no line and service was super fast! Plus they made my drink just the way I like it. Great McDonalds!

They're McDonald's. But they're fast. Probably doesn't make up for the fact that's it's ridiculously unhealthy, but at least the grease can reach my heart that much faster because of the quick service.

I feel shamed to say this, kinda. Every year I gotta have the McRib. This McDonald's was newly remodeled, it looks bright, clean, and during lunch hours it's actually fast. The only downside is that there aren't many seats--I always end up sitting at the big big table, sharing with other strangers.
...Sorry, picked the wrong location - and deleted my review language.

I have nothing bad to say about the actual food or service (although as other reviewers have noted, this location isn't exactly lighting fast).  The reason I'm writing this review is to warn people that the "free wifi" we've come to expect from all McDonalds, and that is advertised at this McDonalds, is often not working at this location. I've gone there on three seperate occasions within the last three months and have not been able to access their wifi.  So if you're stopping in mainly for the use of their internet, go to Starbucks accross the street.

Came here for breakfast since it was just around the corner from our hotel...very convenient. But this Mc Donald's had the worst staff especially the cashier that rang us up. So rude, no smile, didn't repeat my order, made us feel unwelcomed, talking to her Co worker next to her the whole time and in another language. Don't know if they were talking about us or what. Then we sat down to eat and one of the staff started mopping around us and near our feet.  Good thing we didn't slip and fall or else I would've filed a complaint!!!
The only way this place could get worse is if they literally through the food at each of their guest. They do absolutely nothing correct and even worse they know they don't and don't try.
There is a really ugly guy who works behind the counter and he was really rude. He has cheap high lights in his hair. I can't believe that he still works there.

This McDonalds is right next to the hotel we were staying at.  I went there for breakfast, and they didn't have three of items I was trying to order (McSkillet Burrito, Powerade, and Lemonade).  There was no line and it still took ten minutes to get my food.  The McDonalds was dirty and wasn't well kept.  The one thing you can expect from McDonalds is consistency with their food, but I was really disappointed with this location.  To make matters worse, when I got to my hotel room, I realized they had forgotten one of the sandwiches I ordered.  Fail.

Homeless folks and the tourists they hit up for value meals.    You've already found yourself at McDonald's, about to eat your feelings for lunch.  Don't make things any worse by actually eating here.  If you do, you will be approached and asked for change, or if you're dealing with a more enterprising type, an entire meal.    The "clientele" isn't the only pain in the ass here.  Take ordering.  There are lots of registers, but there's no clear directive on where to go after you've placed your order.  You kind of stand off to the side, trying to stay out of everyone's way, continuing your little dance until you're handed someone else's order.  This isn't difficult to correct.  Clear some counter space at the end, have people hold onto their (numbered) receipts, which are then exchanged for the food they bought.  This isn't even a problem at other McDonald's locations, so I'm not sure how they managed it.    I don't really mind that the food was made in China three weeks ago, but fewer bums and a little more organization would go a long way here.

The new workflow is a horrible joke.  They took the worst aspect of this location and made it worse-ER.  Yeah I just made that word up.  I really hate this location but it is so close to my office I'm sure I will still get sucked in.

I can't believe I am reviewing a McDonalds. I am near depression just thinking about it.   Since coming to the states in 1980, I (my mother) managed to destroy my wonderful athletic genes (six pack stomach, professional soccer player) that were being passed down on my fathers side, by introducing me to McDonalds and letting my have my way with it. As a 10 year old she use to buy me a Hot Fudge Sundae, Big Mac, large fries, large soda and a Apple Pie .. in one sitting! I really wish she would have just said NO. Single mother syndrome, I guess.   Ok, now that you have a little be on insight into my McDonald's vs. my fat life - history, I can get on with this review.   This McDonald's has to be the worst McDonalds I have EVER visited! I have been to McDonald's in 40 + states and numerous countries. Some notorious McDonald's located in NYC, Mexico City, Southside and so on. This one beats all of those hands down.   No organization, lines are terrible, 20 people standing in line and 2 registers open w/ 10 plus workers, machines are always down, 40 year old workers with hickies on their neck WTF!. They are chatting all the time. I know because I am Latino and understand their conversation. One of the male workers there has the biggest attitude. I can keep going.   I went one year without eating McDonald's and other fast food, in 2008. This place is making me want to do it all over again. Hmmm, maybe I should give it 5* for helping me out.   Stay away!

This McDonalds is horrible.  Slow, lazy, and they don't enforce their own waiting lines.  I know this means nothing cause I'm yelping a McDonalds, but I need to focus my pre-coffee outrage at someone.

Ok so I pay $2.50 for a Oreo McFlurry and they don't fill the cup up all the way. I'm talking about the cup and not the plastic cover which I understand. Really? I'm not going to pay for full price for something that is only half filled. I almost didn't say anything but I'm like no, F that. The lady was pretty nice and informed me that a they had this problem before with a customer and that this particular McDonald's was strict and wouldn't allow them to fill the cup up but she did. I'm eating the fries and they don't taste as good as they should. Taste like McDonald's fries in Iraq. Boooooo!!!!!!

I love McDonald's.  Of course I was the victim of busy parents and busy schedules with lower-middle-class incomes leading to drive-through McDonald's goodness several times a week growing up.  I refuse to think I'm hooked, because I can quit any time.  And I will go for weeks without a visit nowadays, even months.  And frankly ever since that Supersize Me movie came out and McDonald's starting attempting to "clean up" its act, I visited even less frequently because I don't like what's become of it.  They took away my right to Supersize and tried to bait-and-switch me by saying I had the right to get a salad or fruit slices instead.  They even had a quickly-failed promotion about giving away Fitness DVDs with the purchase of Extra-Value Meals.  McDonald's trying to pretend it's healthy is what is driving away the die-hard fans like me.  The reason why this one in particular gets only two stars is because it's just a bad place.  The register area is a joke.  Why would you have eight registers all across in a big line if you have a physical building that can't handle eight separate lines?  There's a pillar in the way on the left causing a line rift separating the two leftmost registers, and a building niche blocking more than two people at a time waiting on the far right registers.  What you're left with is a giant mass of people in the middle feeling like they're getting screwed by those sneaking to the left or right to flank them in getting to registers.  Add to this the fact that the typical format of register-working involves taking two orders, then disappearing for 3 minutes to fill those two orders, then reappearing to take two more orders and repeating the process.  This causes slow-moving lines and grumpy patrons.  Add to this the fact that even when only taking two orders at a time before filling them - they still screw up.  I ordered two Egg McMuffins and the Sausage Biscuit & Hash Brown deal - FOUR TIMES - and three of those times my order was wrong.  The only reason why this place doesn't get only one star is Gabriel.  I don't know how to explain the phenomenon of "the lone male worker outshines almost all the female workers" that I've noticed at SEVERAL fast-food locations, but it definitely rings true here.  That one time my order was right out of four - Gabriel took my order.  Since then, I try to work my way into his line instead of those featuring women cashiers - not out of misogyny, but out of desperation to correctly get what I ordered.  If you're at this location in the morning on a weekday, aim for Gabriel, and give him a big thank you when he gets your order right - which he almost certainly will.

It's fast food, right?  Well... it's food, at least.  There are three McDonald's within two blocks of my work (maybe more for all I know) and this one has THE WORST SERVICE of any of them.  I understand the people working the counter are getting minimum wage or slightly higher and are not super excited about their jobs or innovating the industry.  But seriously, will someone take my damn order already!??  I can't count the number of times I have been here where I stand in line at a register and when I finally get to the front the person is running around without any clear direction running food to other registers for the people who arrived after me but were lucky enough to win the register lottery.  Multiple times I have had to get someone's attention and remind them that I am still waiting to place my order.  It's not rocket science.  Heck, it's not even science.  It's service.  Plain and simple.  Divide and conquer: one group of people take orders and another group of people run the food while yet another makes it in the back.  Sounds simple, right?  Well it doesn't appear so simple when you walk into this McDonald's.  I have worked in the food service industry as a waiter and I understand that people have different ideas on what is good service but one thing is always constant: greet your customer and communicate with them.  Let them know if you'll be a minute; inform them if there's a wait.  Whatever the issue just let them know; they'll appreciate you more for it and be more willing and patient to wait.  Other than the service this is, well, McDonald's.  Doesn't matter which one you go to you get pretty much the same thing.  That's the hallmark of their business.  The only difference is service.  So, pay attention franchisees: McDonald's may continue to get my money but you independent franchise owners may soon lose valuable customers with poor service.  Afterall, there's a McDonald's within a couple miles just about anywhere in developed countries.

I didn't think that I'd ever be going to a McDonald's for lunch but something was calling me to go grab a Quarter Pounder with Cheese and some fries. I haven't eaten this stuff since I was 16 going up to my friend's mountain cabin and they challenged me to eat the whole Big Mac in one bite.   I went inside and got my food and I looked at it. It looked like it does on the commercials for some reason. So I said "to hell with you, guilty conscience. I've earned this" It was glorious.   I don't know if it's the grease talking, but you know the movie Ratatouille - when the food critic tastes the food and it whips him back to childhood? It was just like that.

This is the lowest of the low when it comes to McDonalds.  I have been to bad ones before, but this one takes the cake.  The waiting lines are extremely confusing, the workers don't enforce them, it's just like a free for all.  The service is horrible.  Went once and the manager took my order for hot cakes, she gave me two butters and no syrup.  This was the manager!  It seems like every other McDonalds understands the concept of fast paces work environment, this one does not, they are as slow as it gets.  Do yourself a favor and go to any other McDonalds in the downtown area (as there are like 40009098).  It is a guarantee it will be better than this disaster of a food establishment.

Surprisingly clean and spacious store. I'm surprised at the other negative reviews here because service seemed perfectly fine to me. There does, however, seem to be a problem with solicitors, so unless you want to be bombarded with requests to buy food for a stranger, don't stick around too long.

I walk past this McDonalds on my way to work in the morning and they are NEVER open at 5:00am like they say.  Lucky to find the doors unlocked by 5:15am.  Once, standing in the rain I stopped by this McDonalds because my co-worker and I take turns buying breakfast a couple times a week .  I stood there at 5:10am (10 minutes after they open) and the doors were locked.  I waited a couple of minutes, gently knocked and the woman FINALLY looked at me, put up her finger and wagged it at me like I was a naughty child.  How rude!  The people working behind the counter are unprofessional, chit-chat all the time, and move slowly on the orders.  DO NOT go to this McDonalds!  There are 2 others nearby!

I don't like patronizing McDonalds but sometimes when I'm in a hurry to catch a train and walking down Adams, I will stop here for a vanilla iced coffee, a fish sandwich, and an apple pie.  Unlike most fat people, I don't like eating at McDonalds that much because I try to eat healthy stuff.  Sometimes if I am in a hurry to eat fast and then get going, I will come here because the people who work here are pretty fast at taking your order and getting your food.  But if you are walking down Adams street, I have to tell you there are much better options like Russian Tea Time, Berghoff's, Starbucks, and even Subway.  But if you are in a hurry and want to feed a lot of people cheaply then by all means come here.  I just urge you to discover the diversity of Chicago and try some Chinese in Chinatown or Middle Eastern on Broadway by Boystown.  There is no drive thru at this location though so don't be expecting that.  If you want drive thru, you have to go to the more expensive one on Ontario or the one on Chicago Ave.  A lot of McDonalds food tastes good but is not really good for you and that is what most of my problem with them entails.

McDonald's is McDonald's, so this review is more for the service and less for the food. The service sucks. How can it take 20 minutes to get me a single McChicken??? By screwing up orders left and right, that's how.
